@hugs The thing I'm most impressed with is how @TeslaMotors incrementally gained my trust through frequent software releases.
The only thing that has changed about my car since I received it 18 months ago is software. @TeslaMotors sends software updates ~ 2 months.
For instance, today, instead of pulling it into my cramped garage, I got out in my driveway, and it parked itself. And it closed the garage.
I've had my @TeslaMotors Model S for 18 months. The things that it can do today compared to when I received it are radically different.

@mikelikesbikes I think for me it's not actually about FTE, it's about an office environment. As an introvert I tended to stay "heads down".
It's a different mode of working than how I used to develop back when I was doing it as a FTE. Not sure if it's better, but it's working.
It was probably less than 90 minutes of focused work, but about 5 different episodes.
Finally I had my breakthrough at a Starbucks tonight. I was waiting to pick up Ricky from lacrosse practice. The algorithm finally appeared!
I would come at the problem a few different times during the day. Always in different physical spaces. Making progress, but not steadily.
I hit a tough problem in my project this week. I would open my laptop for 5 minutes, sort of grimace at the nasty challenge. Then walk away.
Now that I'm coding again, and part-time. I find that I spread the problem-solving out over the entire day.
